2700/A0/06/880/006.headline: Flagship programmes on Child Marriage and Disability continue to gain traction. Gender is strengthened cross sectorally through assigning focal persons and fine tuning of ToC results  narrative and the indicators. C4D plan are underway implementation.

2700/A0/06/880/006.status_value: Slow progress but has gained momentum. Over the past few months within MCO  a broad consensus has emerged to consider disability as one of the core C4D priority issues for 2017. In preliminary discussions with private sector companies  State officials as well as CSO representative largely expressed high interest in challenging misperceptions  attitudes and practices around disability. The KAP research on disability that is being finalized by MCO will provide a solid evidence-based foundation and

2700/A0/06/882/003.headline: Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR)/emergency focal point has been recruited under stretch assignment since March 2017. The March-May 2017 period saw development of a draft DRR strategy  partner identification and initial discussions with key stakeholders. One initial project moving forward includes earthquake education for school children in Sabah.

2700/A0/06/882/003.status_value: A mapping of agencies involved in DRR work in Malaysia was carried out and a joint meeting with MOE and other humanitarian partners was held on 15 August 2016 to look into the setting-up of a national/country-level  (education) humanitarian/DRR cluster. Discussed networking and coordination efforts as well as different tools e.g. using technology/apps to engage adolescents and youth for DRR. Developed a UNICEF contingency preparedness inter-sectoral plan

2700/A0/06/881/003.headline: The study entitled Landscape Analysis on the Double-burden Challenge in Malaysia has commenced in collaboration between UNICEF and the Ministry of Health  in particular the Nutrition Division and the Institute of Public Health as well as academics. This study is a key step to enhancing the work on child nutrition.

2700/A0/06/881/003.status_value: No. Guidelines on sales of and marketing of unhealthy foods and sugar-sweetened beverages in schools and school vicinity is currently being revised . The focus to further strengthen foods listed as banned in school.
2700/A0/06/881/003.indicator_name: Advanced draft of legislation on sale  provision and marketing of unhealthy foods and sugar sweetened beverages to children in schools and in the vicinity of schools  which are in line with international standards (WHO) completed and submitted for approval for adoption by MoE.

2700/A0/06/881/002.headline: Strategy for Capacity Development of NGOs in child rights advocacy completed and roll out planned by end 2017. Resources committed for nationwide roll-out of child protection good practice pilot by government. Strategy to address challenges to birth registration of unregistered children and sustainable capacity development for child justice agencies required.

2700/A0/06/881/002.status_value: 0. The Child Rights Committee of the Bar Council is now looking into incorporating child rights training annually. In 2016  they conducted 2 trainings for 56 lawyers. For the Attorney General Chambers (prosecutors) and the judiciary  given that challenges have arisen in implementing a TOT approach and adopting this as part of their annual training  an advocacy/policy decision is required at a higher level. This will be pursued in 2017. Capacity development for probation officers is only due to s

2700/A0/06/881/002.status_value: ¿	Malaysia submitted its baseline report on CRVS as part of the Regional Action Framework on Civil Registration and Vital Statistics  which contains data on current birth registration rates. The report also contains CRVS targets set by the Government on birth registration. However  disaggregated data on birth registration is still not publically available to measure progress towards achieving these targets. Advocacy by UNICEF on this continues
2700/A0/06/881/002.indicator_name: Nationally representative data exists measuring progress towards CRVS Regional Action framework targets.

2700/A0/06/881/001.headline: Sports events were successfully used to raise awareness and promote inclusion of children with disabilities. 20 Journalists had training on disability ethical reporting.
